title: Google OAuth 2.0 Authentication Success
description: Verify that users can successfully authenticate with Google OAuth 2.0 and are assigned appropriate roles (User, SQA, Admin) accordingly.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Initiate Google OAuth 2.0 sign-in.
Confirm that the user is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard.
Verify the user role is assigned and enforced based on their account (User, SQA, Admin).

title: Google OAuth 2.0 Authentication Failure
description: Verify the system handles failed or unauthorized Google OAuth authentication attempts gracefully.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Attempt to sign in with invalid or denied Google OAuth credentials.
Verify that appropriate error message is displayed.
Confirm that user remains on login page and no access is granted.

title: Dashboard Load and Display
description: Verify dashboard loads correctly showing quick actions and recent issues statistics.

steps.description: Log in as any role.
Navigate to the dashboard page.
Confirm that quick actions (create issues) are visible.
Verify recent issue statistics are displayed accurately and updated.

title: Issue Creation with Valid Data
description: Test creation of a new issue using the creation modal with valid data, attachments, and verify correct Jira SQA template submission.

steps.description: Navigate to issue creation modal from dashboard or quick action.
Fill in all required fields (status, priority, type, reporter, summary, description) with valid data.
Upload an attachment adhering to size and type constraints.
Submit the issue creation form.
Verify that the issue is created successfully and displayed in the issue list.
Confirm that the backend sends the correctly formatted Jira SQA template to Jira Cloud.
Check that success toast notification is shown.

title: Issue Creation Validation Errors
description: Verify client-side validation errors and toast error notifications are triggered when submitting incomplete or invalid data in the issue creation modal.

steps.description: Open the issue creation modal.
Attempt to submit the form without filling required fields.
Confirm validation messages appear for missing mandatory fields.
Upload an invalid attachment (unsupported type or oversized).
Verify upload is rejected and appropriate error message is displayed.

title: Issues List Pagination and Filtering
description: Verify that the issues list supports pagination, filtering by status, priority, type, reporter, and search functionality correctly updates displayed results.

steps.description: Navigate to the issues list page.
Apply filters for status, priority, type, and reporter individually and in combination.
Confirm the list updates to show only matching issues.
Use the search bar to query issues by keyword.
Verify that the search results are relevant and displayed.
Navigate across pages using pagination controls.
Confirm correct pagination behavior and UI updates.

title: Detailed Issue View Permissions and Editing
description: Verify the detailed issue view loads all information correctly and editing capabilities respect user roles and ownership rules.

steps.description: Open a detailed issue view as a User role where user is the reporter.
Confirm issue details, comments, attachments, and activity timeline are displayed.
Attempt inline editing of permitted fields.
Verify that editing is allowed only on own tickets.
Repeat above steps as SQA and Admin roles.
Confirm SQA and Admin can edit and delete according to permissions.
Add a comment and upload attachments.
Verify comments and attachments are saved and displayed correctly.

title: Backend Jira Cloud Integration Error Handling
description: Test that backend integration with Jira Cloud handles API errors and retry logic correctly during issue creation, updates, and attachment management.

steps.description: Simulate Jira Cloud REST API downtime or errors during issue creation.
Verify backend retries requests as per retry policy.
Check appropriate error responses propagate to frontend with user notifications.
Attempt updating an issue or uploading an attachment during API failure.
Verify error is caught and handled gracefully with feedback.

title: Email Notification Delivery Respecting Preferences
description: Verify that email notifications are sent via SendGrid on issue creation, status changes, and new comments according to individual user notification preferences.

steps.description: Create a new issue with multiple users configured with different email notification preferences.
Confirm email notifications are sent only to users who have opted in.
Update issue status and add a comment.
Verify subsequent email notifications respect user preferences.

title: Discord Notification Posting with Correct Formatting
description: Verify that Discord notifications post formatted messages to dedicated channels for bugs, tasks, and stories reflecting issue events.

steps.description: Create, update, and comment on issues of various types (bug, task, story).
Confirm that Discord notifications are posted to correct channels.
Verify message formatting is accurate and consistent with templates.

title: Polling System Update and UI Indicator
description: Verify that issue data is refreshed every 60 seconds via polling with UI indicators shown and proper error handling for failed polls.

steps.description: Load the issue list or detail view.
Observe that data updates at 60 second intervals.
Confirm UI indicators signal polling status.
Simulate network failure during polling.
Verify error is handled gracefully and user is notified.

title: Bulk Status Updates Authorization and Functionality
description: Verify bulk status update feature is accessible only to SQA and Admin roles and status changes apply correctly with UI update.

steps.description: Log in as User role and navigate to issues list.
Confirm that bulk status update option is not available.
Log in as SQA or Admin role.
Select multiple issues and perform bulk status update.
Verify status updates apply immediately and are reflected in UI.
Confirm success toast notification is shown.

title: User Profile Preferences Update
description: Verify that users can update notification preferences for email and Discord as well as theme settings, and changes persist correctly.

steps.description: Navigate to user profile page.
Update email and Discord notification preferences.
Confirm changes save successfully with confirmation toast.
Toggle theme preference between dark and light modes.
Verify UI reflects theme changes immediately and system preference detection works.
Reload application.
Confirm that preferences persist after reload.

title: Admin Role and User Management
description: Verify that Admin users can manage user roles and system settings via Admin dashboard and changes enforce access rights.

steps.description: Log in as Admin.
Access the Admin settings page.
Modify roles of users and update system configurations.
Confirm changes are saved successfully with feedback.
Verify that updated roles affect user permissions upon next login.

title: Toast Notification Display and Error Handling
description: Verify that toast notifications for success, error, and information messages appear appropriately in response to user actions and errors.

steps.description: Perform various actions including successful issue creation and submission errors.
Confirm toast notifications appear with correct messages and styles.

title: Protected Routes and Navigation
description: Verify client-side routing protects routes that require authentication and appropriate error boundaries handle unexpected failures.

steps.description: Attempt to access protected routes while logged out.
Confirm redirection to login page.
Access various authenticated routes after login.
Verify navigation works correctly and unauthorized role prevented from accessing admin pages.
Force a runtime error in a component.
Confirm error boundary displays fallback UI and user notification is shown.

title: Dark/Light Theme Switching and System Preference Detection
description: Verify application theme changes based on user preference and system-level theme settings with ability for user override.

steps.description: Set system theme preference to dark mode.
Load the application and verify initial theme matches system preference.
Change theme manually in user profile.
Confirm manual theme setting overrides system preference immediately.
Reload application.
Confirm user theme preference is persisted and applied.

title: Attachment Upload Constraints and Error Feedback
description: Verify attachment uploads enforce size and type constraints and provide clear error feedback when validation fails.

steps.description: Attempt to upload a multipart attachment within allowed constraints.
Confirm upload succeeds and attachment is shown.
Attempt to upload a file exceeding allowed size or unsupported file type.
Verify upload is rejected and user receives clear error notification.

title: Database Role and Preferences Persistence
description: Verify LibSQL database correctly manages and persists user roles, settings, notification preferences, and activity logs.

steps.description: Perform updates to user roles, notification preferences, and theme settings.
Trigger activity log entries by performing relevant actions.
Confirm database state reflects all changes and logs persist.

title: Deployment and Environment Configuration
description: Verify successful deployment on Vercel with configured environment variables and secure external API integrations (Google OAuth, Jira API, SendGrid).

steps.description: Deploy application to Vercel environment.
Confirm environment variables are securely configured.
Verify Google OAuth login works in deployed environment.
Confirm Jira Cloud integration functions with correct API keys.
Verify SendGrid email notifications send correctly.
